content.text: To establish a robust and cyclical Quality Assurance (QA) framework that ensures all Eduversal Partner Schools consistently meet high standards of educational delivery, comply with regulatory and accreditation requirements, and foster a culture of continuous, evidence-based improvement.

subsections.title: The QA Framework: A Multi-Layered Approach

content.text: Our QA framework integrates internal self-assessment with external validation, ensuring both accountability and support. It is built on the P.I.E. model (Plan, Implement, Evaluate) described in Section 4.

items.title: Layer 1: School-Based Self-Review (Internal)
points: Regular lesson observations and work scrutiny by school leadership.

items.title: Layer 2: Eduversal Network Review (Internal-External)
points: Annual 'Supervisi' (Supervision) visits from the Eduversal Head Office.
Centralized analysis of network-wide data (e.g., EASE results).

content.text: The SSE is an annual, reflective process led by the school's leadership team to honestly assess performance against all Eduversal Academic Standards.

content.title: Annual SSE Cycle
content.purpose: To identify strengths and prioritize areas for improvement for the upcoming academic year.

steps.title: Data Gathering (Term 3)
steps.desc: Collate all relevant data from the year: exam results, EASE data, survey feedback, observation summaries, attendance records.

steps.title: Departmental Review (Term 3)
steps.desc: Heads of Department lead their teams in a SWOT analysis based on the data, focusing on their subject area.

steps.title: Leadership Analysis (Term 4)
steps.desc: The School Improvement Committee (SIC) analyzes all departmental reviews and whole-school data to identify overarching themes.

steps.title: SER & SIP Creation (Term 4)
steps.desc: A formal School Evaluation Report (SER) is written, which directly informs the creation of the next School Improvement Plan (SIP). See Section 4.

content.text: The annual 'Supervisi' visit by the Eduversal Head Office team serves as a 'critical friend' review to validate the school's self-evaluation and provide targeted support.

content.title: Supervisi Visit Protocol
rows: School submits its latest SER, SIP, and key data dashboards to the Supervisi team. A schedule is co-created.
Lesson observations, learning walks, interviews with Principal, HODs, teachers, students, and parents. Review of physical evidence (student work, policy documents).
Verbal feedback to the leadership team on the final day. A formal written report with commendations and prioritized recommendations is delivered within two weeks.

content.text: The recommendations from the Supervisi report must be incorporated into the school's active School Improvement Plan.
Monitoring the quality of teaching and learning is the most critical QA function. This is done through a balanced and developmental observation and feedback cycle.

content.title: Key Monitoring Activities
items: Formal Lesson Observations: At least one per teacher per semester, part of the formal appraisal process (see Section 12). Uses the Eduversal Teaching Standards (ETS) rubric.

Learning Walks/Walkthroughs: Frequent (weekly), short (5-10 minute), informal visits to multiple classrooms by leadership to gauge school-wide trends and climate. Feedback is general and non-judgmental.

Work Scrutiny ('Book Looks'): Termly review of a sample of student notebooks/portfolios by HODs and leadership. Focus is on curriculum coverage, quality of marking/feedback, and evidence of student progress over time.

content.label: Cross-Reference
content.text: The standards for teaching and feedback are defined in Section 7: Teaching Quality and Practice.
The voices of students, parents, and staff are essential data points for quality assurance.

items: Annual Surveys: Formal surveys are administered to all three stakeholder groups annually. Results are disaggregated and analyzed for trends.
Parent-Teacher Conferences (PTCs): Formal opportunities for feedback on individual student progress and general school matters.
Open Forums: 'Principal's Coffee Mornings' and other open-door events provide informal channels for feedback.
Student Council: A formal body for channeling student voice to school leadership.
